title: A Mean Field Game between Informed Traders and a Broker. (arXiv:2401.05257v1 [q-fin.TR])
abstract: We find closed-form solutions to the stochastic game between a broker and a mean-field of informed traders. In the finite player game, the informed traders observe a common signal and a private signal. The broker, on the other hand, observes the trading speed of each of his clients and provides liquidity to the informed traders. Each player in the game optimises wealth adjusted by inventory penalties. In the mean field version of the game, using a G\^ateaux derivative approach, we characterise the solution to the game with a system of forward-backward stochastic differential equations that we solve explicitly. We find that the optimal trading strategy of the broker is linear on his own inventory, on the average inventory among informed traders, and on the common signal or the average trading speed of the informed traders. The Nash equilibrium we find helps informed traders decide how to use private information, and helps brokers decide how much of the order flow they should externalise

translated_title: 一个在知情交易者和经纪人之间的均场博弈
translated_abstract: 我们找到了经纪人和一群知情交易者之间随机游戏的闭合形式解。在有限玩家游戏中，知情交易者观察到一个公共信号和一个私有信号。经纪人则观察到每个客户的交易速度，并为知情交易者提供流动性。每个游戏中的玩家都通过库存惩罚来优化财富。在均场版本的游戏中，我们使用Gâteaux导数方法，通过求解明确的向前向后随机微分方程系统来描述游戏的解。我们发现，经纪人的最优交易策略是基于自己的库存、知情交易者之间的平均库存，以及公共信号或知情交易者的平均交易速度的线性关系。我们发现的纳什均衡帮助了知情交易者决定如何利用私有信息，以及帮助经纪人决定他们应该外部化多少订单流量。
tldr: 本文研究了知情交易者和经纪人之间的均场博弈，找到了经纪人的最优交易策略与知情交易者的私有信息利用之间的平衡点，以及经纪人应该外部化多少订单流量的决策依据。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates a mean field game between informed traders and a broker, finding the optimal trading strategy of the broker and the balance point between informed traders' use of private information, as well as the decision on how much order flow the broker should externalize.
